ETYMOLOGY: From Latin digitus 'finger, toe, a numeral' (because numbers were counted on the fingers).
SINCE: Late 14th century (for finger/toe), Mid 15th century (for numeral)

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A noun is a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Any of the numerals from 0 to 9, forming part of a number.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 构成一个数字的0到9之间的任一数码。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A noun is a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The cat has five digits on its front paws.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这只猫前爪有五个脚趾。
